title: Shenandoah National Park names new deputy superintendent
abstract: Superintendent Patrick Kenney has announced that Raquel Montez will be the next deputy superintendent of Shenandoah National Park.

image.altText: A woman with brown hair in a tight bun. She is wearing a gray ranger shirt, green cross tie, and oval glasses.
image.title: Raquel Montez

title: Black Friday “Opt Outside” Hike at the National Park
abstract: Instead of shopping on Black Friday, opt outside for an expert-led, family-friendly hike at Indiana Dunes National Park on Friday, November 29, from 1:00 pm to 4:00 pm at West Beach.

title: Pipestone National Monument Visitor Center Winter Operations & Holiday Closures
abstract: Starting December 1, 2022, and running through February 28, 2023, Pipestone National Monument Visitor Center’s normal winter hours will be 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Tuesday through Saturday, closed Sundays and Mondays. The Visitor Center will also be closed Thursday, November 24, 2022, for Thanksgiving Day.

title: Haleakalā National Park Community Volunteer Ambassador Internship Program
abstract: Applications are now being accepted for the yearlong Community Volunteer Ambassador (CVA) Program at Haleakalā National Park. This paid internship opportunity begins February 6, 2022 and lasts 50 weeks. The CVA intern will help expand the park’s service-learning, community engagement, and volunteer programs. Haleakalā National Park is looking for an enthusiastic young conservationist who is committed to strengthening the bonds between the local Maui community and the park.

title: Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River Now in Mandatory Cold Water Life Jacket Wear - 2023
abstract: The National Park Service reminds everyone that may be out on the Upper Delaware River this fall or winter in a boat, canoe, or kayak that each person, regardless of age is required to wear a Coast Guard approved personal flotation device (life jacket or PFD) during these cold weather months. This regulation is effective immediately through April 30, 2023.

image.altText: Trees in the background are red, yellow, and orange in color. A river runs right to left with two boaters on the water.
image.title: Trees in the background are red, yellow, and orange in color. A river runs right to left with two boaters on the water.
image.caption: Fall river scene with two boats on the water.

title: Park Seeks Applicants for Advisory Commission Seat
abstract: Keweenaw National Historical Park (NHP) is seeking applicants to fill an expired seat on the Keweenaw National Historical Park Advisory Commission.

title: Lincoln Home National Historic Site Hosts Programs During December
abstract: Lincoln Home National Historic Site will host three different programs throughout the month of December. The park ranger-led programs are free and open to the public.

image.altText: Ice-covered branches, with the Lincoln Home out of focus in the background.
image.title: LIHO Ice
image.caption: Ice at Lincoln Home

title: Repair work begins on bridges across Great Smoky Mountains National Park
abstract: Park officials announced that the Federal Highway Administration awarded a construction contract to conduct routine bridge repairs at 19 locations across the park through August 2023. Crews will implement single-lane closures in most locations to safely accomplish work, however, full road closures will be necessary at a few, select sites.

image.altText: A side view of a bridge anchored with stone pillars and supports. A grassy bank lines the river flowing beneath.
image.title: 11.15.22 Spur_Wiley Oakley Bridge_side view

title: Advisory Commission to Meet November 16, 2022
abstract: The Keweenaw National Historical Park Advisory Commission will convene for its regular quarterly meeting at 1:00pm on Wednesday November 16th, 2022. The meeting will be held in-person at the Keweenaw National Historical Park Headquarters building.

title: Fort Donelson Visitor Center Operations to be at Dover Hotel "Surrender House" Tuesday and Thursday of this week
abstract: Fort Donelson Visitor Center Operations to be at Dover Hotel "Surrender House" Tuesday and Thursday of this week.

image.altText: Visitor Center Front 2021
image.title: FODO-Media.Image2-VC.Front

title: Yellowstone visitation statistics for October 2022
abstract: Yellowstone National Park hosted 232,117 recreation visits in October 2022. This is a 27% decrease from October 2021 (316,662 recreational visits), and a 36% increase from October 2019 (171,339) which was the last year before COVID.

image.altText: A woman hikes in a field of golden grass with snowcapped mountains in the distance.
image.title: Beaver Ponds Trail
image.caption: A person hikes along the Beaver Ponds Trail in fall.

title: Winter at Craters of the Moon
abstract: The visitor center will be closed from Monday, November 28, 2022, through Thursday, January 26, 2023. The Loop Road and trails (excluding the Caves Area and all caves) are open 24-hours per day and accessible by biking, hiking, snowshoeing, or skiing only.

image.altText: snow covered cinder cones at Craters of the Moon
image.title: Big Cinder Butte and Inferno Cone are visible from the top of Paisley Cone

relatedParks.fullName: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve
relatedParks.name: Craters Of The Moon

title: Celebrate "A Christmas Past"
abstract: The birthplace of Herbert Hoover, 31st President of the United States, will host “A Christmas Past” December 2nd and 3rd.

image.altText: Luminaries line the sides of an historic road in Herbert Hoover National Historic Site.
image.title: Christmas Past
image.caption: Historic Downey Street illuminated for "A Christmas Past"

title: Yellowstone National Park reduces fire danger to LOW
abstract: Yellowstone decreased the parkwide fire danger level from MODERATE to LOW.

image.altText: Sign showing fire danger is low
image.title: Yellowstone fire danger low

title: Dunes Learning Center Announces New Executive Director, Heather Hahn Sullivan
abstract: The Dunes Learning Center Board of Directors is pleased to announce Heather Hahn Sullivan as the new Executive Director. Her predecessor, Geof Benson, announced his intent to retire earlier this year.

title: Michelle Kerns Selected as Superintendent of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument
abstract: Michelle Kerns announced as Superintendent of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument.

image.altText: Park ranger in formal uniform outdoors smiling at the camera
image.title: Michelle Kerns, Superintendent Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument
image.caption: Michelle Kerns, Superintendent of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument

title: Heart of Maui: New Haleakalā National Park Film on Saving Forest Birds
abstract: Haleakalā National Park released a new film, Heart of Maui.  This 7.5 minute documentary follows two biologists working to save Hawaiʻi’s critically endangered forest birds. The film describes the cause of the birds’ catastrophic decline and what is at risk if action is not taken soon.

image.altText: Heart of Maui Walking

title: Sustainable Low Water Access Plan
abstract: Lake Mead National Recreation Area seeks public input on new low water access plan. Public meetings to be held the week of December 5.

image.altText: Aerial photo of Boulder Harbor Islands with calcium deposit "bathtub ring" from low water
image.title: Boulder-Harbor-Islands-low-water-aerial-small

title: Students get creative for the 100th National Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony
abstract: From state flowers to notable landmarks, American students have designed one-of-a-kind ornaments to celebrate the places they call home. These ornaments will adorn 58 smaller trees that surround the National Christmas Tree.

image.altText: State trees decorated with handmade ornaments from the 2021 America Celebrates ornament program.
image.title: State trees 2021
image.caption: America Celebrates trees in 2021. Ornaments designed by students from each state, territory, and more, adorned small trees around the National Christmas Tree.

title: Towne Pass section of CA-190 into Death Valley National Park open
abstract: Towne Pass section of CA-190 is now open to all vehicles. This provides access from the west into Death Valley National Park.

image.altText: View of Towne Pass section of CA-190 overlooking Panamint Valley. Contruction vehicles stationed on shoulder of the paved road.
image.title: Towne Pass
image.caption: View of Towne Pass section of CA-190 overlooking Panamint Valley. Contruction vehicles stationed on shoulder of the paved road.

title: Canaveral National Seashore Post Hurricane Nicole Status Update
abstract: Canaveral National Seashore is slowly recovering from widespread damage due to Hurricane Nicole. Visitors to Canaveral National Seashore should continue to exercise caution while in all areas where access is allowed.

image.altText: Sand washes over the Playalinda Beach roadway.
image.title: Sand washes over the Playalinda Beach roadway.

title: Agate Partners with the UniDescription Project to Create Audio Description of Their Park Brochure
abstract: Are you a collector of the NPS park brochures? You must check out the unique audio described version! Staff at Agate Fossil Beds National Monument participated in a Descriptathon and now have an audio described version of the park brochure. It's available on our website and the UniDescription app,

image.altText: Two rangers in uniform sit in front of a computer screen in an office. The screen reads, "Descriptathon 9" with a list of links below it. 5 people sit in different rooms on a Zoom window. A magnifying glass and a park brochure are prepped below the screen
image.title: Agate D9 Work
image.caption: Two Agate rangers participate in Descriptation 9.

title: Lassen Volcanic and the National Park Service Honors Veterans
abstract: The Biden-Harris Administration announced that starting on Veterans Day (Nov. 11), veterans of the U.S. Armed Services and Gold Star Families can obtain a free lifetime pass to more than 2,000 federal recreation sites spread out across more than 400 million acres of public lands, including national parks, wildlife refuges, and forests, including Lassen Volcanic National Park.

image.altText: Military Pass
image.title: 2023-Military-Lifetime-Pass_front_2
image.caption: NPS/2023 Military Lifetime Pass - front

title: Yosemite Declares End to the Fire Season
abstract: Yosemite National Park experienced widespread precipitation and snow accumulation recently. The closure of the fire season occurs when there is a season ending precipitation event totaling two inches or more.

title: Manhattan Project National Historical Park Featured in 2023 Passport to Your National Parks® Stamp Set
abstract: Denver, CO – Manhattan Project National Historical Park (NHP) takes center stage as the national stamp in the highly anticipated 2023 Passport to your National Parks® Stamp Set released by Eastern National on November 1st. The national stamp is the large center stamp in a collection of 10 stamps that honor national parks. Sure to become a collector’s item, the 2023 national stamp features three photos from Manhattan Project NHP locations in New Mexico, Tennessee, and Washington.

image.altText: A grid of photos and text.

title: UPDATE: Gatlinburg Trail and Twin Creeks Trail reopen
abstract: Park officials reopened the Gatlinburg Trail between Gatlinburg and Sugarlands Visitor Center, and also the Twin Creeks Trail between Gatlinburg and the Twin Creeks Science and Education Center.

title: Ozark National Scenic Riverways honors veterans with special activities
abstract: Ozark National Scenic Riverways (ONSR) recently hosted two special events in honor of military service members and veterans. The 9th annual Exceptional Warrior Mobility Impaired Managed Hunt was held on October 22 and 23 at Big Spring. The annual Hike to Honor Veterans was conducted on November 5 from Rocky Falls to Stegall Mountain.

image.altText: Two men wearing blaze orange one is in a wheelchair the other is standing, they are holding a harvested buck deer.
image.title: SMLN2666
image.caption: A hunter utilizing a special track chair and his hunt assistant, also a veteran of military service, proudly display a buck harvested during the Exceptional Warrior Mobility Impaired Managed Hunt.

title: Maegan Lopez Presents for Casa Grande Ruins Speaker Series November 23, 2022
abstract: The Casa Grande Ruins Speaker Series takes place weekly through January 18, 2023. On November 23, 2022 Casa Grande Ruins will host Meagan Lopez at 1:00 pm. Maegan will present " Traditional O’odham Agriculture". The speaker series will continue every Wednesday at 1:00 pm through January 18.

title: Blue Ridge Parkway 2022 Winter Travel Update
abstract: Visitors reminded to plan ahead for winter travel on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Winter maintenance activities may impact park access.

title: New Lifetime Pass Available for Military Veterans and Gold Star Families to Access Public Lands
abstract: On Veterans Day, November 11, 2022, veterans of the U.S. Armed Services and Gold Star Families can obtain a free lifetime pass to more than 2,000 federal recreation sites spread out across more than 400 million acres of public lands, including national parks, wildlife refuges, and forests.

image.altText: 2023-Military-Lifetime-Pass_front
image.title: 2023-Military-Lifetime-Pass_front
image.caption: Photo of the new Lifetime Military Pass

title: A Good Old-Fashioned Christmas Family Fun Event at the Preserve
abstract: Strong City, KS: Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve is pleased to announce the upcoming good old-fashioned Prairie Christmas event on November 26th from 12 p.m. to 4 p.m. All activities are free and open to the public.

image.altText: Children listening to 'Twas the Night Before Christmas'
image.title: Children listening to 'Twas the Night Before Christmas'
image.caption: Children listening to Twas the Night Before Christmas

title: New trail in Del Norte County in the ancestral territory of the Tolowa People
abstract: The Tolowa Dee-ni' Nation (“Nation”) and Redwood National and State Parks (Parks) are excited to announce the completion of a new trail in Del Norte County.

image.altText: A large group of adults and a dog gather at a trailhead.

title: Peacock Bar Renamed and Given New Signage
abstract: Redwood National and State Parks ("Parks") and the Tolowa Dee-ni’ Nation (“Nation”) have collaborated to rename Peacock Bar.

image.altText: Five adults stand next to a brown sign that has Tolowa language information on it.

title: National Park Service, U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service to evaluate options for restoring grizzly bears to the North Cascades
abstract: The National Park Service and U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service today announced the initiation of a new Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) process to evaluate options for restoring and managing grizzly bears in the North Cascades of Washington, where the animals once thrived.

image.altText: Two grizzly bear cubs in a grass field
image.title: Grizzly bear cubs

title: It’s Beginning to Look a Lot Like Christmas at the Eisenhower Home
abstract: Tis the season! Eisenhower National Historic Site is happy to share that once again we will deck the halls, throw some tinsel on the tree, and bring the Eisenhower home alive with the spirit of the Christmas season!

image.altText: A decorated room for Christmas. There is a colorful lit tree with wrapped presents on the right. There is a fireplace and mantle with a painting in the middle. There is a tan armchair and a red poinsettia on the right.
image.title: The Eisenhower home is decorated for Christmas.
image.caption: The Eisenhower home is decorated for Christmas.

title: Amanda Rumsey joins NPS Division of Fire and Aviation as data scientist
abstract: Amanda Rumsey has been selected as a data scientist for the Division of Fire and Aviation’s Information Technology & Resource Management (ITRM) Branch.

image.altText: Amanda Rumsey.
image.title: Amanda Rumsey
image.caption: Amanda Rumsey has been hired as a data scientist for the NPS Division of Fire and Aviation.

title: Acadian Cultural Center Hosting First Annual Youth Art Showcase
abstract: The Acadian Cultural Center is pleased to host its first annual Youth Art Showcase. Lafayette Parish students in grades 6-12 are encouraged to participate.

relatedParks.fullName: Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve
relatedParks.name: Jean Lafitte

title: Special Programs Commemorate 160th Anniversary of the Battle of Fredericksburg
abstract: Join the National Park Service as we commemorate the 160th Anniversary of the Battle of Fredericksburg with guided programs December 9-13, 2022.

title: UPDATE: Park fire near Chilhowee Lake now 100% contained
abstract: Park officials reported that the wildfire near Chilhowee Lake is now 100% contained. Firefighters removed damaged trees along Highway 129 to reduce roadside hazards for motorists.

title: Lincoln Home National Historic Site Hosts Candlelight Tours
abstract: SPRINGFIELD, IL: The Lincoln Home National Historic Site will host candlelight tours from 4:45p.m. to 6p.m. on December 10.

image.altText: A 19th century parlor with bright red wallpaper is dimly lit by candlelight.
image.title: LIHO_candlelight_tours
image.caption: The Lincoln Home Sitting Room, illuminated by candlelight.

title: Winter Hours of Operation at Andrew Johnson NHS
abstract: The site will transition to winter hours of operation in December.

image.altText: homestead in snow
image.title: Winter-25

title: Lincoln Home National Historic Site Hosts “A Message at Midnight” Play
abstract: Lincoln Home National Historic Site will host the play “A Message at Midnight” December 8 at 6p.m., December 9 at 6p.m., and December 11 at 3p.m. in the Visitor Center.

title: Joshua Tree Celebrates Native American Heritage Month
abstract: Joshua Tree National Park management is pleased to join the National Park Service in celebrating Native American Heritage Month, and in honoring the 15 traditionally associated tribal communities as the original stewards of the land on which Joshua Tree National Park now sits.

title: Motor vehicle accident results in fatality
abstract: Yesterday, at approximately 11 a.m., Teton Interagency Dispatch Center received a call reporting a motor vehicle accident on U.S. Highway 89 in Grand Teton National Park. Park rangers responded to the scene involving an SUV and a semi-truck near Teton Point Turnout.

image.altText: National Park Service Arrowhead with bison, tree, mountain, and National Park Service written in text inside the arrowhead.
image.title: National Park Service Arrowhead with black background

title: Tropical Storm Nicole Update
abstract: Tropical Storm Nicole Update: The park remains open on 11/09/22, but with minimal services available. Park staff are closely monitoring the storm and will update this page if any closures go into effect. Please check this site for updates before visiting the park on 11/10/2022.

title: Echo Canyon and Hole in the Wall backcountry roads reopen
abstract: Hole in the Wall Road and Echo Canyon Road reopened on November 9. The NPS road crew re-established these backcountry roads after they had been partially erased by flash floods. A free permit is now required to camp along these backcountry roads.

image.altText: A gravel road in the foreground, a rocky ridge in the background.
image.caption: Site #6 in Echo Canyon.

title: Voyageurs National Park Overnight Camping Reservations and Houseboat Permits for the 2023 Summer Season Open November 15
abstract: Park staff would like to remind visitors that overnight tent camping reservations and houseboat permits for the 2023 summer season will become available on November 15, 2022, at 9 am CST.

title: Everglades National Park reopens Everglades City location
abstract: On November 11, Everglades National Park will reopen the Gulf Coast area of the park in Everglades City with limited services. Restrooms, parking and the canoe/kayak launch will reopen to provide paddlers with access to the 10,000 Islands and wilderness camping.

image.altText: A view from the water of a building and a marina with two boats,
image.title: Gulf Coast Visitor Center and marina
image.caption: The Gulf Coast Visitor Center and marina

title: Winter Returns to Cedar Breaks National Monument
abstract: Following the first significant snowfall since early October, Cedar Breaks Scenic Byway (Hwy. 148) and Rim Road (the road through the park) were closed for the season on Tuesday, November 9. The closure of the roads comes a month earlier than last year and marks the end of busy summer season at the park.

title: Yellowstone National Park’s Mammoth Hot Springs Hotel to remain closed for winter 2022-2023
abstract: Yellowstone National Park’s Mammoth Hot Springs Hotel will remain closed this winter season, Dec. 2022 through March 2023. The hotel closed immediately after the historic June flood because of damage to the area’s wastewater system. The hotel will be closed to overnight guests and food services will not be provided.

image.altText: A large white hotel sits below mountains in the background. Snow covers the ground.
image.caption: Mammoth Hot Springs Hotel with Sepulcher Mountain
